channel.title: So my life just fucked up!
channel.description:
[s]So i just got kicked out of work because of the stupid government cutting down on workers for the council, so without an income I can't keep my house and my partner is pregnant with my child.[/s]
[s]Life's a bitch then you die.[/s]
Okay, I've been put on a training scheme that's charity based through funds from the Welsh assembly government, this has allowed me back into my I.T based job but I will only get a maximum pay of £62 a week providing I work for the full 5 days. Hopefully if I show my employer that I am worthy of keeping this job they might re-hire me, but this will depend on my work.
Knowing my partner is pregnant is giving me a huge boost to keep this up, hopefully no one else will go through what I've been through the past few days or.. even worse.

item.title: So my life just fucked up!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:42, topic:389473”]I work at pizza hut and they just cut my pay. I’m now payed lower than minimum wage when I leave for a delivery, but when I come back into the store from a delivery it goes back to minimum wage. It’s the dumbest shit I’ve ever hear.

I also have a car that is junk and falling to pieces and I’ve put about $2000 into when the car itself is barely worth $2000. The world is really depressing.

And ironically enough, as I am posting this, I’m listening to Mad World by Gary Jules lol.[/quote]How can you be paid less than minimum wage? Does being out driving not count as real work or something?

Read full topic
item.source: So my life just fucked up!

item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:1, topic:389473”]So i just got kicked out of work because of the stupid government cutting down on workers for the council, so without an income I can’t keep my house and my partner is pregnant with my child.

Life’s a bitch then you die.

Okay, I’ve been put on a training scheme that’s charity based through funds from the Welsh assembly government, this has allowed me back into my I.T based job but I will only get a maximum pay of £62 a week providing I work for the full 5 days. Hopefully if I show my employer that I am worthy of keeping this job they might re-hire me, but this will depend on my work.

Knowing my partner is pregnant is giving me a huge boost to keep this up, hopefully no one else will go through what I’ve been through the past few days or… even worse.[/quote]
As I said, things can only get better now. You’ve been given another opportunity let’s hope the fuckers don’t take it away again. Its alright for them in their comfy chairs and fat cheques every month, wankers.

[/quote]
His partner can also get a job and help out.[/quote]

item.title: So my life just fucked up!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

m.dog311:

Well if it makes you feel any better, the federal government here (US) can’t agree on a budget plan, so as of Friday (iirc) all federal employees stop being paid, and most still have to work.

Forgot to mention, last year, the state of Michigan went bankruped (happens every 1-2 years since 9-11) last year for 3 days. The US’s problem though, is that we have TOO much government, we seriously don’t need over 400 people in one house, trying to agree, 100 just like the other house would do just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: So my life just fucked up!
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Thug-life:

Why would you have to leave your partner? That is ridiculous.

Because I wouldn’t be able to afford to live around here, I would of had to move quite far away from here back with my parents. But seems my redundancy money is going to keep helping for now I will just have to try and find a good job to replace it.

Wintercanon:

Leaving your pregnant girlfriend, douchebag move. Look for another job you irresponsible dick. If you don’t want to commit to her, than don’t fuck her without protection.

I wouldn’t have just left her and the child, maybe I didn’t explain it so well in the original post but that’s because the stress and frustration I was under at the time.

Read full topic

item.title: So my life just fucked up!
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I was kicked out of my mums when I was 16, lived on sofas, hotels and hostels, living out of black bags, for 5 years. Then I found my partner and we had a baby boy.

You’ll have to swallow your pride and get emergency housing on housing benefit for a while until you get back on your feet. They cannot keep you on the streets if you’re having a child, so you’ll have a roof over your head.

Best of luck mate, I’ve been through what you’re going through, so if you’re ever feeling down just drop me a message and we can have a chat.

Read full topic
item.source: So my life just fucked up!
